SEARCH
Package edu.kit.unwwi.checkpoints.qemu.models

Klasse Blockdevice

java.lang.Object
edu.kit.unwwi.checkpoints.qemu.models.Blockdevice
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
JSONable, Serializable
public class Blockdevice extends Object implements Serializable, JSONable
A class representing any kind of blockdevice, which usually are any form of drive backed by a file on the host.
Siehe auch:

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Blockdevice

      public Blockdevice(@NotNull @NotNull String device, @NotNull @NotNull String qdev, @Nullable @Nullable Path path, long virtualSize, long actualSize)
      Create a new Blockdevice.
      Parameter:
      device - The QEMU-name of the device.
      qdev - The qdev-ID or QOM-path, depending on QEMU internal assignment.
      path - The path to the file backing the device if available.
      virtualSize - The size of the device shown to the guest.
      actualSize - The size currently taken up on the host disk.

  • Methodendetails

    • setHashAlgorithm

      public static void setHashAlgorithm(@NotNull @NotNull MessageDigest digest)
      Set the hash algorithm to use for segment comparison.
      Parameter:
      digest - The digest to use.

      The size the backing file is taking up on the host's disks.

    • hasMedia

      public boolean hasMedia()
      Whether this blockdevice has any medium associated with it, e.g. an ISO-File of a drive or a qcow-file.
      Gibt zurück:
      Whether this device has media.

    • getHash

      public byte[] getHash() throws IllegalStateException
      Returns a hash of the medium associated with this blockdevice. The hashing method can be set using setHashAlgorithm. All instances of Blockdevice share the same algorithm, as one probably wants to compare the files later on.
      Gibt zurück:
      The hash of the associated medium
      Löst aus:
      IllegalStateException - Gets thrown if this device doesn't have any medium associated with it, and therefore doesn't have a hash.
